column1:
Japanbuilder,"2017-07-14T07:06:27.56Z","Definitely packed with plenty of joy within. ","

This set offers a great value and balance of things to do for your young Friends fan. Let'
column2: s take a look as to why one might hold that opinion:

column1: The packaging is rather simple for what is actually within the box. We get a decent representation of Olivia in her work area designing robots and other gadgets. Front and back give a good impression and the colors are well suited for the theme.

Inside you will find a great set of parts for a set of this size. You get not one but two bags of tools. One of those is a replacement bag but still it is great to get two of them. The tools are also in a light sand blue like color which makes them really stand out.
You will also get 2 bags and a small sticker sheet included in the set. Thankfully none of the stickers are cleared-backed which removes a bit of worry when applying them. However,
column2: if your builder is still on the younger side I would strongly suggest helping them as the stickers do add a bit of character to Olivia&#39
set and it is Olivia. She comes with a decent torso piece (that sadly has no back printing) and a nice mix of lavender and hot pinks to round out her appearance.&nbsp

column1: The build may be a bit of a challenge for a younger builder but for older fans of the theme it will fly by in an instant. The multitude of stickers though may slow you down a bit but thankfully they are not too difficult to apply.

When you finish you will get 3 robots a design table and what appears to be a docking bay for the 3 robotic creations. I also really liked the buildable heart included in the set, my daughters use it as a stand for Olivia and it fits her well.
For the price the pieces in this set are great to have. The robots really grab the imagination and if you don'
column2: t already have Olivia and are looking for a way to get her easily then this set is for you. Pretending to be the designer and working on the robots seems to be amusing and it is certainly fun to change the layout of these work spaces to suit your&nbsp
column3: play needs. A good deal to be sure.&nbsp

column1: ,TRUE,5,5,5,5,5 Odeinoichus","2018-03-22T16:54:50.293Z","A 2012 Set Update which works quite well.","
column14: > Carrying on with the mechanical ingenuity Olivia possesses, the Creative Lab is a brilliant looking set and goes well with the original Invention Lab from 2012, this set improves greatly on the original model, while expanding the work area Olivia has access to when combining both sets together in her home or a display.

column8: >Box: This box is pretty much the same as the others from the wave I&rsquo
column9: ve already reviewed, this time I Heart Olivia&rsquo
column10: s picture is on one side and her new robot Zobito is on the other, the art really adds to the appeal and draw of the box honestly.

column8: >Instructions: The manual is great, it does its job perfectly and the imagery stands out, the new back covers really grabbed my attention and I enjoyed their look.

>There are not a lot of parts in this set, but we do get some nice elements, a lot of them surrounding the buildable robots, while the rest includes a nice tealish blue set of work tools and a purple drawer holder. Not a bad grouping of parts for the price.

column9: ve seen in the past, though perhaps not entirely in this same combination, Olivia looks superb. She includes the usual light purple skirt piece and the heart printed tee top. She includes a built-up robot control device using a LEGO Walkie Talkie piece and a stickered tile for the detailed controls.

column8: >Included with her as characters, instead of pets, are her built up robots. Zobo returns from the original Invention Workshop, featuring a similar upper torso build while this time he&rsquo
column9: s been given wheels, he also gets a &lsquo
column13: depending on your play preferences, Zuzu who has a printed radar dish for a lower dress and a very small little robot called Zobito. The &lsquo
column15: of the group. Some great looking buildable robots.

column9: s a pretty quick and easy build for what you get in this box, there aren&rsquo
column10: t a lot of things that stand out to me honestly. It does feature sticker placement however, some builders may require assistance to place the stickers on properly. The builds for the robots are all fairly similar, ah, yes one thing to note, pay close attention to which studs go where. They are colour coded and I&hellip
column12: made a slight mistake in which stud I used resulting in the wrong look for the character until I realized my mistake. Even with the simple to follow instructions AFOLS like me can still make mistakes when rushing through the build.

column8: >There are two things to this set, a Robot Power Docking station where the three robots go when not helping Olivia, and a work station/bench with tools, a spot to build a diagram of how Zobito was put together and a tile piece with an image of Olivia and Zobo, this is a very nice touch for detailing because this image was made similar to the ones Emma is working with in her Photo Studio. So you can pretend Emma is printing this picture off for Olivia and then giving it to her if you have both sets.

column9: s also a heart shaped model build with two pink pieces and a small container with parts and a printed shipping label which is a very nice touch, Olivia just ordered something from Amazon for building another robot apparently.

column8: >I really love the uniformity and awesome simple designs found in this set. Olivia has always been a favorite of mine, she embodies some great role model ideals for young girls and she&rsquo
column9: s a very creative individual capable of building little robots that just really struck me as being so unique and fun. Added this is a great update to the original Invention Workshop, and it doesn&rsquo
column10: t have everything the same so you can combine the two together if you bought both and have a pretty large diorama area to play with.

column8: >I really strongly recommend this set, while it doesn&rsquo
column9: t look like much on the box, it does have great charm to it and the tools in those unique colours are a great addition as well, I like them a lot better than the original purple tool set she had in 2012.
